intro: Edraianthus sutjeskae, commonly known as the Sutjeska bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces clusters of delicate, tubular flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
